text: <@U7AU6414J> did you ever figure out how to do this? :pray::skin-tone-2:

I have an older portal that is not working well with the new `time_frame` parameter in the `blog_popular_posts()` function
```{% set pop_posts = blog_popular_posts('default', 3, [], 'popular_past_six_months') %}```
`pop_posts` is returning posts from 2018.

Does this happen to anyone else in older portals?

I’ve even tried including logical operator and setting tags to null:
```{% set pop_posts = blog_popular_posts('default', 3, null, 'popular_past_six_months', 'AND') %}```

Wait, does the `time_frame` param just analyze the popularity of posts in the specified time frame?
or does it filter out posts not in the time frame?
is there a way to get all meetings for a sales rep through a hubl tag? i'm imagining something like a for loop as if you were getting hubdb rows being returned for each meeting.

I’m beginning to think:
• It does not include posts in the timeframe
• It uses the timeframe to analyze what is the most popular post...
• so a post from 2018 could be on of the most popular posts in _the last six months_
If that’s the case then boooooooooo :-1::skin-tone-2:
<@U7SL518D6> am I correct on the time_frame param?
It dictates the timeframe of analytics to look at

thanks for the confirmation <@UCJANAW1Y>
Maybe one day we can get a `post_date_range` or `newer_than` param added?
I don't have the bandwidth to add that in now. We have plans in the future for work on these functions which return blog posts so we'll keep this idea in mind
so you're telling me there's a chance
<@UATE4ATHP> I did not unfortunately, and there was no other alternative that I implemented.
